office: New England Democrat and member of the House Veterans’ Affairs Committee
key_responsibilities: developing proactive legislative initiatives
tracking legislation
drafting correspondence and statements
representing the Member in meetings
requirements: ability to work in a fast-paced team environment
previous experience in veterans or health care policy

key_responsibilities: coordinating media relations efforts with print, digital, and broadcast outlets
drafting press releases and other materials
supporting an active and energetic press shop
requirements: ability to operate quickly and efficiently in a fast-paced environment under tight deadlines
ability to work collaboratively with a large and diverse staff
experience in web management and social media
previous communications experience on the Hill

key_responsibilities: None
requirements: excellent written and oral communication skills
comfortable working both independently and as part of a team
strong knowledge or connection with Nevada’s First Congressional District

key_responsibilities: developing and maintaining Member’s official schedule both short and long term
organizing domestic and international travel logistics
working closely with the chief of staff on administrative duties
requirements: excellent written and oral communications skills
ability to work well in a team environment

key_responsibilities: managing Members schedule including organizing and tracking invitations, meetings, committee schedule, speaking engagements, member travel scheduling requests and managing day to day schedule and logistics
assisting the chief of staff with administrative functions
requirements: strong verbal and written communication skills
ability to balance competing demands in a fast-paced environment maintaining close attention to detail and maintain a positive attitude

key_responsibilities: greeting visitors
processing flag and tour requests
training and supervising interns
providing support to the congressman and legislative staff
management of an active constituent correspondence program
monitoring the flow of incoming and outgoing mail and responding to mail and email in both form and individual letters in a timely manner
requirements: excellent writing, editing and multi-tasking skills
ability to work well with others
experience with the Intranet Quorum database and Microsoft Office

key_responsibilities: None

familiarity with the NDAA, overall budgeting, and the ability to track major acquisition and RDT&E programs
prior legislative experience with the Defense Authorization and Appropriations Process
ability to multi-task and work under tight deadlines
ability to engage in creative policy-making

key_responsibilities: maintaining the Member’s official schedule, travel plans, and related records
briefing the Member on scheduling activities in Washington and presenting proposed meetings to Chief of Staff and Member for input
coordinating the scheduling of press, interview, radio, and television with the Communications Director

office: The House Committee on Science, Space and Technology (Majority)
key_responsibilities: managing committee press team and coordinating with professional staff
working with press secretaries in Committee Members’ personal offices
drafting op-eds and press releases
proactively working with the local and national media
requirements: strong writer who can communicate public policy on a District, state and national level and can operate in a fast-moving, high pressure environment
at least three years of professional experience

key_responsibilities: None
requirements: excellent writing, research, and communications skills
ability to work in a fast-paced team environment
detail-oriented self-starter who is willing to take on additional tasks as assigned
at least 1 year of related Capitol Hill experience
familiarity with IQ constituent management system

key_responsibilities: overseeing the Committee’s administrative functions
managing a nonpartisan administrative staff who are responsible for ensuring the efficient operation of the Committee’s work
requirements: minimum of 5 years of experience with government administrative process
outstanding analytical and written and oral communication skills
experience in one or more of the following areas: accounting, office administration, and familiarity with Congress

key_responsibilities: conducting investigations and adjudicatory and disciplinary proceedings regarding Members and staff of the U.S. House of Representatives
requirements: outstanding analytical and written/oral communications skills
sound judgment necessary to evaluate the sensitive matters that arise before the Committee
experience in one or more of the following areas: government ethics, criminal law, civil litigation, administrative investigations and adjudications, depositions, and financial accounting

key_responsibilities: press clips
daily social media posts
assisting the communications director with press releases and press inquiries
answering phones
giving tours
interacting with constituents

ability to boil down complex issues into easily understandable social media content
self-starter with the ability to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment
ability and interest in learning to create graphics and edit video

working with local and national reporters, producers, and bookers
